column1: Janet Yellen has a deep understanding of our economy and I’m glad I was able to listen to her advice with the @NewDemCoalition at the onset of the COVID-19 crisis.   She was an extraordinary Federal Reserve chair and she will make an extraordinary Treasury Secretary.

As a resident of Nassau County I couldn't be more proud of how well our County Executive has handled the #COVID19 outbreak from its onset. Thank you @NassauExecutive for your remarkable leadership during this crisis.    https://t.co/YgvcXTjmtu

An estimated 7 million people who don't typically file taxes may miss out on their COVID-19 stimulus check. Use the IRS Non-Filer Tool to register for your payment before the November 21 deadline: https://t.co/5ODzeW2uTv

Officials and cybersecurity experts are worried that bad actors will spread disinformation to try to undermine public confidence in COVID vaccines.   I implore you to be diligent and make sure the news you read is coming from reputable sources. https://t.co/WrMOlsRlpc
#COVID19 is on the rise. We must all do our part to combat this troubling trend.   Wear a mask 😷 Practice social distancing 📏 Wash your hands 🧼  https://t.co/64hH7bhj3w

#COVID19 cases are surging with the colder weather. We must keep practicing social distancing wearing our masks and avoiding large group gatherings.   Please don't let your guard down! https://t.co/ND3sHEdfME

This #VeteransDay as we honor those who served my heart is with the veterans and their families who have been affected by #COVID19.   Veterans are among the hardest-hit populations by this pandemic. We must continue to do everything we can to support them through this crisis. https://t.co/4SK5r3tErw

The Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) has helped save nearly 160000 jobs in #NY04 since we created it in March. But our small businesses still need relief and the program is now closed.   We must reauthorize PPP & pass a new bipartisan COVID relief bill. https://t.co/WW3L3FW2sY

Proud to have an American flag flown over the U.S. Capitol in memory of Mineola Volunteer Ambulance Corps past-president Frank Nedelka who passed away due to COVID-19.  Frank's dedicated service to his community will never be forgotten. https://t.co/l6dc4OkP65

COVID-19 cases are rising again nationwide.   As the weather gets cooler and we spend more time indoors please continue to wear your mask practice social distancing & avoid large group gatherings.   We cannot afford to lose the great progress we've made.https://t.co/EEnwBWzKL7

I led the Long Island delegation in a bipartisan letter to the IRS requesting that existing commuter benefits rules be relaxed so that commuters with unused benefits can use this money to get through the COVID-19 crisis. https://t.co/sOWWhwPH6d
My statement on recent COVID-19 restrictions. https://t.co/G5QQe0QHh6
You can help stop the spread of #COVID19 in New York by downloading the new mobile contact tracing app “COVID Alert NY”.   More information here 👇 https://t.co/xYkd8O5cNs

Our constituents don't want us at home campaigning while businesses are shuttering & families are suffering. They want us working to pass a new relief bill.    The House should stay in session until a bipartisan compromise on #COVID19 relief is reached. No exceptions. https://t.co/DO19xxw9Bc

We cannot be complacent especially as the weather gets cooler and we spend more time inside.   Please continue to wear your mask & practice social distancing. And visit https://t.co/aocKEa0lYJ for the latest information on #COVID19 resources in #NY04. https://t.co/7bM7nrl1vt

I voted today in support of @RepGraceMeng’s H.Res.908 which I cosponsored to condemn anti-Asian discrimination related to #COVID19.    The anti-Asian rhetoric we've heard during this pandemic - including from the President - is bigoted and dangerous. It cannot be tolerated.

Without federal aid critical local programs and services will be cut. Yet Senate Republicans are still proposing no #COVID19 relief for state & local governments. It's outrageous.   @RepTomSuozzi & I won't stop fighting for the funding @NassauExecutive and our communities need. https://t.co/4zha8QvPps

Newspaper readership is up but ad revenue has been hit hard by #COVID19.   That's why I'm supporting @RepNewhouse & @RepKirkpatrick's Local Journalism Sustainability Act to provide tax credits for local papers in need of relief.   Local news is essential and we must preserve it!

On July 31 I led a letter with my @NewDemCoalition Housing Task Force colleagues calling for expanded housing assistance in the #COVID19 relief bill agreement.    Millions of families will lose their homes if Congress does not act. We must not fail them. https://t.co/G3UOyD7fL0

I'm proud to support the RESTAURANTS Act which will provide relief to local dining establishments enduring the hardships of #COVID19.   Restaurants are critically important to our local economy and community culture and we must make sure they are supported through this crisis. https://t.co/Fist5T3qZA

Today is August 1st – a day that too many families have been dreading because it either means rent or yet another mortgage payment is due.   Expanded mortgage relief and housing assistance must be included in the next #COVID19 relief package. https://t.co/tRWlsmE1hz

The situation is dire on Long Island and in communities across the nation. State & local governments need funding in the next #COVID19 relief bill.   Thank you @NassauExecutive & @SteveBellone for speaking with the LI delegation today and helping us fight for these federal funds. https://t.co/FZcJ7JpNQc

I met with the mayors of #NY04 today to discuss the continued #COVID19 response in Nassau County the importance of state and local relief in the next coronavirus relief package and ways we can all work together for our constituents. https://t.co/hos4ctA3LK

Pleased both the NYS Assembly and Senate passed the Healthy Terminals Act. Thousands of @32BJSEIU airport workers are risking their safety to report for duty during the #COVID19 outbreak. They deserve to have quality affordable health insurance.

NYS has announced a new COVID Rent Relief Program to provide eligible households with a one-time rental subsidy that will be sent directly to the household’s landlord.  Households can apply for up to 4 months in assistance. More info is available here ⬇️  https://t.co/7Z1vxTcx2U

My hearing yesterday made it clear: ICE contractors are not doing enough to protect detainees and workers from #COVID19.    We are in a pandemic and people's lives are at risk. Detainees who pose no threat to communities should be released.  https://t.co/cU3U0TPzbx

As #COVID19 cases surge the health of detainees and of workers at ICE facilities are not being protected.   Today we will press ICE contractors to take action to stop the spread of the virus at these facilities. Lives are on the line. https://t.co/pGaId34Zsh

Canada contained #COVID19 much  better than our federal government. President Trump should take notes.  We cannot reopen our border immediately but the important ties between our nations demand we have a science-based plan in place to do so when it’s safe. https://t.co/T0L06T9OuX

Long Island will begin Phase 4 of reopening on Wednesday.  Please keep practicing social distancing & wearing masks so we can keep this momentum going.   For more information on the #COVID19 response & reopening please visit https://t.co/aocKEa0lYJ. https://t.co/dZ4fvXUGZF

New Yorkers take notice. #COVID19 cases are surging in other states that have not taken this virus seriously.   Keep following the reopening regulations wear masks and practice social distancing.   The pandemic is not over.  https://t.co/bSXBqcMl7p

Great town hall meeting with @ASMEdotorg this afternoon. Grateful for your work to promote engineering and allied sciences and thank you for your ongoing advocacy through the #COVID19 crisis.    If you missed it check out our discussion here: https://t.co/0ylZ25C5k1 https://t.co/JdZtWffWlP

Attention #NY04 Small Businesses: In case you missed it the SBA has reopened the Economic Injury Disaster Loan (#EIDL) program for those impacted by #COVID19.    See below for more info and to apply ⬇️ https://t.co/D6SZT9czK8

#NY04 small businesses: I’m hosting a call tomorrow to discuss the SBA small business loan programs & the Employee Retention Tax Credit. Please join us to learn more and have your questions answered about #COVID19 relief. https://t.co/NloQTeadez

We owe a tremendous debt of gratitude to MTA workers for keeping our trains running. They have been hard hit by #COVID19 and still the Long Island Rail Road schedule is back up to 90% of normal weekday service.    THANK YOU! https://t.co/OQzpx4v22Z

Met with representatives from @NYSCADV & @vibsuffolk to discuss the alarming increase in domestic violence we have seen during the coronavirus outbreak. The needs of survivors must be addressed in the next #COVID19 federal relief bill. https://t.co/9qAOWevr91

Today I joined community leaders from local chapters of the @NAACP to discuss racial injustice and how community programs have been hard hit by the coronavirus pandemic.   Grateful for their leadership as we work to secure the funding needed to overcome this crisis. https://t.co/VfaPHCkJxc
Last night I spoke with a group of Long Island pediatricians about the #COVID19 response. So grateful for their work to keep our children safe through this crisis. https://t.co/LFxRDiqlPe

More good news as the latest data shows a dramatic decrease in new #COVID19 cases on Long Island. But PLEASE keep wearing masks and social distancing whenever possible. We can't afford to lose the hard-fought progress we have made.  https://t.co/GiMFMRIIbB

New York State is still hiring contact tracers to support the NYS Department of Health and local health departments to perform #COVID19 contact tracing in communities across the state.   For more information and to apply online please see below.  https://t.co/tR9uouCmWy

A new pilot program in NYC is being launched to use ultraviolet light to eliminate #COVID19 on city buses and trains. If successful the program will expand to Long Island Rail Road in the next phase. https://t.co/6zadlNJhtv

Grateful to Dr. Fauci for speaking with me and my fellow @NewDemCoalition colleagues today to provide an update on the coronavirus crisis and share his insights as we look to restart our economy. https://t.co/szt8iuJ2hc
#COVID19 antibody testing is available at the following locations in Nassau County.    Pruebas de anticuerpos de #COVID19 están disponibles en los siguientes lugares. https://t.co/yAoYoATHci

Sending my deepest condolences to the family of Abe Goldstein a 101-year-old WWII veteran & former 𝑔𝑎𝑏𝑏𝑎𝑖 of the Elmont Jewish Center who passed away due to COVID-19.    Mr. Goldstein represented the best of our community. He will be missed dearly. https://t.co/sQu4X3TYOE
#COVID19 antibody testing is available at the following locations in Nassau County.    Pruebas de anticuerpos de #COVID19 están disponibles en los siguientes lugares. https://t.co/l7VFsXzt5p

Nassau County has spearheaded the regional response to #COVID19 and continues to lead the way. That's why the Town of Hempstead must make the federal #CARESAct funding it received available for use by the County.  https://t.co/gUFimxyyhV
I will be on the @BrianLehrer Show from 10-10:30 a.m. to give an update on the #COVID19 response and take caller questions. You can listen live here ⬇️ https://t.co/BAT5GAz60F

The Long Island Trauma Recovery Network is providing free therapy to those who have been impacted by #COVID19.   For more information please email LongIslandTrauma@gmail.com or call (631) 466-7053.  https://t.co/e0YS4TEdlr

The nonprofit arts & cultural community has been impacted greatly by #COVID19 social distancing restrictions.   We need to provide additional assistance to our museums libraries and cultural institutions in the next coronavirus recovery package. @CIGNYC @NY4CA

#NY04: Aquí está una lista actualizada de los sitios de prueba de #COVID19 en nuestro distrito.  Visite https://t.co/Ln4DuDgPvM para información y recursos. Llame al (516) 739-3008 si tiene preguntas. https://t.co/ctVTe8pLWV

#NY04: Here is the up-to-date list of #COVID19 testing locations in our area.    Visit https://t.co/Ln4DuDgPvM for additional information and resources and please call us at (516) 739-3008 if you have any questions. https://t.co/G0y9JoPSTY

The coronavirus outbreak has exposed the great disparities and health inequities facing minority communities. We need new federal policy & protections to ensure communities of color are not left behind in times of crisis.   https://t.co/9uuiqFVUWX

Spoke with @ForABetterLI about how we're working to mitigate the economic consequences of the #COVID19 outbreak. Grateful for all you are doing to protect and strengthen the Long Island economy during this crisis. https://t.co/k28JElmvRh
It was great connecting with AJC Long Island yesterday to mark #YomHaatzmaut and discuss the latest efforts to combat #COVID19 in our communities. https://t.co/M7Cu0BbdKi
Please tune into our town hall this evening as we discuss our bipartisan work to combat #COVID19 in Nassau County. https://t.co/Zg1Sq9ee8I

Dr. Scott Roethle an out-of-state anesthesiologist from Missouri was inspired by his faith to come to @MS_SouthNassau to help out on the front lines.   We are thankful for his service and all @ASALifeline is doing in the fight against #COVID19. https://t.co/LDVzzqRE4C

Dr. Scott Schubach recovered from #COVID19 after spending 8 days in the hospital and has already returned to the front lines @NYUWinthropHosp. His perseverance and dedication is an inspiration to us all.   Thank you Dr. Schubach! https://t.co/vLvyHcH5Ki
The @US_FDA has helpful guidance on how to shop safely for groceries during the COVID-19 pandemic. Please check out these tips before your next trip to the store: https://t.co/O24rgGgXZ9

#NY04: Remember that while April 15th is typically #TaxDay this year's filing deadline for federal and NYS tax returns have been extended to July 15th due to the coronavirus outbreak. More information below. ⬇️ https://t.co/WyiIZ18wCM

These are tough times for all of us if you need someone to talk to you can call the NYS COVID-19 Emotional Support Line at 1-844-863-9314 or visit the Office of Mental Health website if you are feeling anxiety stress or depression. https://t.co/MG2gys0UE0
Debido al clima los sitios de prueba de coronavirus en Jones Beach Park y otros lugares están cerrados hoy. Se espera que abran el martes. https://t.co/MakxtMv6Wq

Es claro que el COVID-19 afecta desproporcionadamente a las comunidades minoritarias incluyendo la comunidad hispana en Long Island.  Hay que aumentar el acceso a los exámenes en las comunidades minoritarias. https://t.co/ADaeIcQczm
Here's what you need to know about coronavirus testing on Long Island. https://t.co/rFSCaWthFL

Thank you @NYGovCuomo for asking the Trump Administration to take COVID-19 patients on the USNS Comfort. @MichaelJDowling was right about this last week - @USNavy and @DeptofDefense must allow the use of this ship for the fight against coronavirus. https://t.co/wM7OZZLCjv

Economic Injury Disaster Loans (EIDL) are available for working capital to small businesses suffering from substantial economic injury as result of the coronavirus outbreak. Find out more here: https://t.co/76WMij7pPe  (2 of 4)
Proud to lead this effort with @NewDemCoalition leadership to urge continued and comprehensive response to the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/oW0u8n87i5
Thank you for your leadership @MichaelJDowling. The USS Comfort should be made available for the treatment of COVID-19 patients. https://t.co/oKjAt87BtU

Some government services on Long Island have been disrupted by the coronavirus outbreak. See the link below for a comprehensive list.    If you have questions or require assistance with a federal agency please give my office a call at (516) 739-3008.  https://t.co/N07we768C6

My thoughts and prayers are with the friends and family of Joseph Lewinger especially his wife Maura and three young children.  This is a sad reminder that COVID-19 can be dangerous to all ages. Please keep following CDC guidelines.  https://t.co/MBEGzaYnUt

The coronavirus pandemic has caused shortages of donated blood across the country and many are unsure if it is safe to give.   @NYBloodCenter has information about donating blood during this crisis: https://t.co/vBUa2Re6cj
El paseo marítimo en Long Beach está cerrado debido al COVID-19. Por favor deben mantener 6 pies de distancia en público.

With more people staying home due to coronavirus there has been an increase in domestic violence on Long Island.    If you need help or support you can contact the Safe Center (@TSCLI) at 516-542-0404 or LI Against Domestic Violence at 631-6666-8833.    https://t.co/tb6897iC7V
Statement from Rep. Kathleen Rice on Third Coronavirus Response Bill: https://t.co/NYLdyfqGDj

Please visit https://t.co/FZKCxcSTrH which is continuously updated with the latest coronavirus information and resources available to small businesses veterans students and all residents of #NY04. https://t.co/I0YSgznRw3

Estos son momentos que causan mucho estrés.  Si necesita apoyo emocional marque a la línea directa de Nueva York sobre COVID-19: 1-844-863-9314.   Se puede encontrar unos consejos para manejar la ansiedad en el sitio web de la Oficina de la Salud Mental. https://t.co/MG2gys0UE0

These are stressful times. If you are feeling overwhelmed or need help call the New York State COVID-19 Emotional Support Line at 1-844-863-9314.  Tips for managing anxiety and stress can also be found on the Office of Mental Health website. https://t.co/MG2gys0UE0

New York has new paid leave protections to support families affected by the coronavirus outbreak.  Call the Paid Family Leave Helpline at (844) 337-6303 or check out the link below⬇️  https://t.co/owDvWUuypP

This is a national crisis and time is of the essence. Congress must be allowed to vote remotely so we can safely and quickly pass legislation to combat the coronavirus outbreak and provide relief to those who need it. https://t.co/9DwBsnxjiy

ATTN small businesses: Our last coronavirus response bill included new tax credits to fully reimburse the cost of providing paid leave to employees.   These funds will be quick and easy to obtain. Find out more ⬇️  https://t.co/palosajs0n

I'm proud to stand with @32BJSEIU and the thousands of airport workers in NY and across the country who are being laid off due to the coronavirus outbreak. These workers must be taken care of first in any industry bailout. https://t.co/kHFs5WZwUu

As a member of @NewDemCoalition leadership I helped craft these priorities to ensure a swift comprehensive and successful economic response to the coronavirus outbreak.  We need to take action NOW to provide relief to those who need it most. https://t.co/vXWMHhsxw5

Scammers are using illegal robocalls and phishing emails to take advantage of people especially senior citizens during the coronavirus outbreak.   Check out these helpful tips from the FTC on how to avoid them. https://t.co/QMDz76BtTL

These senators need to be investigated. Anyone who is trying to profit off the coronavirus is not fit to hold public office.  At the very least the senators should take every penny they made on these trades and immediately purchase ventilators and PPE.   https://t.co/Tyd4aOQOdp

New York State of Health is offering a special open enrollment period to obtain health insurance through April 15 due to the coronavirus outbreak.    If you don’t have health coverage you can sign-up here: https://t.co/jnA7lnJTeG

Savor Health provides nutrition support for cancer patients in need. Throughout the coronavirus outbreak they are offering unlimited access to their “Intelligent Nutrition Assistant” chat bot for questions.   Check out this resource here: https://t.co/cvQdo7MDus

Small business owners: @SBAgov is offering low-interest federal disaster loans for small businesses impacted by the coronavirus outbreak.  More info can be found in the fact sheet below and here: https://t.co/VmZf4ugrnD https://t.co/EgTxkarn7a

Please visit our Coronavirus Resource Page so you can stay up-to-date with the latest information. It will be continuously updated as we find out more about this virus and how it affects our communities. https://t.co/e77UClZ231 https://t.co/qKNHY01RON

Drive-through coronavirus testing is up and running at Jones Beach: West End 350 Bay Parkway Field 2.  Testing is by appointment only and must be scheduled by calling the @HealthNYGov hotline at 1-888-364-3065. https://t.co/Rv0KHG6PXg

#NY04: A las ocho esta noche varias normas surten efecto para prevenir la propagación del COVID-19:  -Los restaurantes y los bares ofrecen la comida para llevar y entregas -Se prohíben las reuniones de más de 50 -Los gimnasios los teatros y las empresas no esenciales cierran

#NY04: At 8pm tonight several new rules will take effect to prevent the spread of coronavirus including:  - Restaurants/bars will be take-out & delivery only  - No gatherings over 50 people - Gyms theaters and other non-essential businesses closed  https://t.co/OOsO7qNR4b

Last night I voted to pass the coronavirus response agreement to provide free testing paid leave unemployment benefits and expanded food assistance to American families.   The time is now to protect our communities and save lives. https://t.co/A1zfijlrvt

As the coronavirus outbreak continues older adults and those with chronic medical conditions are most at risk.     @CDCgov has important guidance on how you can best protect yourself and the older adults in your life. ⬇️ https://t.co/KwFKLHMtP1

.@NassauExecutive Health Commissioner Dr. Larry Eisenstein and Dr. Sunil Sood from @NorthwellHealth will be at my town hall tomorrow.  Join us for an update and to ask questions related to the coronavirus outbreak.   https://t.co/cAtkkcjv8y https://t.co/zvpotLWYT2

This action at the federal level is needed but we must all stay diligent in our daily lives as well. @CDCgov recommends several everyday preventive actions to help stop the spread of respiratory diseases like coronavirus. https://t.co/am2t9eE06t https://t.co/9QPg79S41E

Today I will vote to authorize $8.3 billion in new federal funding to combat the coronavirus. The federal government must do everything possible to prevent its spread and keep Americans safe. https://t.co/7W93KBhz8B

As predicted we have seen more cases of coronavirus in the U.S. including the first reported case in NYC.   There is no reason for alarm but we should be diligent. @HealthNYGov has up-to-date information on the virus and how to stay protected. ⬇️ https://t.co/P9tYZ6slrL
